I am having a strange, intermittent problem with jfcunit (downloaded 
from CVS on Saturday).

I have a test:

    public void testOneValue() throws Exception {
        m_helper.sendString(this, m_controller, "2");
        assertEquals("Not set correctly", "2", m_controller.getText());
        Thread.sleep(1000);
        m_helper.sendKeyAction(this, m_controller, KeyEvent.VK_ENTER);
        Thread.sleep(1000);
        awtSleep();
        Thread.sleep(1000);

        assertEquals("Model not updated", new Integer(2), 
m_model.getData().lastElement());
        assertEquals("Controller not cleared", "",    
m_controller.getText());
        assertEquals("Not updated correctly",  "2.0", 
m_averageView.getText());
        assertEquals("Not updated correctly",  "2\n", 
m_listOfValuesView.getText());
    }

That runs against a simple MVC gui where the controller is a JTextField. 
 The model is connected to it via an ActionListener.

When I run it the model is usually not updated, occasionally it is (I 
cannot reproduce it at will).  The second test assertEquals("Model not 
updated"...) fails.

Can anyone give me a hint as to what is going on?  I am sure I am 
missing something obvious but I am not sure what.

Thanks.

Tom
